decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with small creatures and use them to consistently apply pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Knight of the White Orchid to buff your creatures and generate value, along with removal spells like Stasis Snare to deal with threats, this deck aims to establish and maintain a strong board presence while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Gideon of the Trials and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional threats and powerful abilities to further enhance your game plan.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board with efficient creatures and removal spells, while disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize. The deck aims to apply pressure early with creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Rankle, Master of Pranks, and maintain tempo with creatures that can return from the graveyard like Scrapheap Scrounger and Bloodsoaked Champion. The inclusion of Castle Locthwain provides card advantage, while cards like Murderous Rider offer flexibility as both removal and a creature. The deck's mana base is streamlined with a mix of basic Swamps and Mutavaults for additional creature pressure.

This deck focuses on using the Dimir Inverter combo to win the game by decking yourself out and then winning with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle. It uses a variety of card draw spells and disruption to help assemble the combo pieces and protect them from the opponent's interaction. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the combo and win the game in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on generating a fast and aggressive offense using low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells. By leveraging the abilities of cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Knight of the White Orchid, the deck aims to establish early board presence and put pressure on the opponent quickly. With additional support from Gideon planeswalkers and utility lands like Castle Ardenvale, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while disrupting their game plan with Stasis Snare and Rest in Peace. The deck aims to win through efficient combat and smart use of its resources.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. By manipulating the graveyard and drawing cards efficiently, the deck aims to bring out Inverter of Truth to put the library upside down, followed by playing Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck includes disruption and protection spells to ensure the combo goes off successfully. It also includes a mix of removal and counterspells to control the board while setting up the win condition.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having no cards left in the library. It also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Thought Erasure to control the opponent's hand and board state. The deck also features card draw spells like Dig Through Time and Opt to find the combo pieces efficiently. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries provides an alternate win condition if needed. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and other mana producers, while also building up a strong board presence with green creatures. Utilizing cards like Voracious Hydra and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early on with aggressive plays. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator helps to disrupt opposing strategies and provide additional utility. Overall, the deck emphasizes green devotion and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with a variety of aggressive Spirit creatures. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to flood the board with powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Queller and Nebelgast Herald. Maintaining a balance between aggression and protection, the deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base supports a smooth curve and consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells and creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of smaller creatures while also utilizing powerful enchantments and planeswalkers to maintain control of the board. Cards like Stasis Snare and Elspeth Conquers Death provide removal options, while Walking Ballista and Heliod, Sun-Crowned offer ways to pump up the smaller creatures and deal additional damage. The deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to a quick victory through efficient aggression and synergy between the various cards in the deck.

This control deck seeks to utilize the powerful card advantage and selection provided by Niv-Mizzet Reborn to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and versatile threats, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily building its own resources. The deck includes a toolbox of one-of spells and a diverse mana base to efficiently cast the multicolor spells in the deck. By utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a centerpiece, this deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small creatures known as "weenies" while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Gideon and Heliod to support and boost the team. The deck includes cards that enhance creature power and efficiency, as well as removal spells to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and apply constant pressure to the opponent, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of creature attacks and strategic use of card abilities.

The deck focuses on utilizing a diverse range of cards to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to stall out the game until it can cast Niv-Mizzet Reborn, which provides card advantage and can help dig for more answers. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the spells in the deck, allowing for consistent casting of powerful spells across all five colors.

The deck focuses on utilizing spirits with aggressive abilities to overwhelm opponents quickly. By casting spells like Collected Company and using creatures with flying and pump effects, the deck aims to create a fast-paced tempo game. Key cards such as Empyrean Eagle and Nebelgast Herald help boost the spirits' power and provide disruption to enemy strategies. With a mix of counterspells and creature-based aggression, the deck aims to maintain board control and apply pressure to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Spirit Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost spirit creatures, using cards such as Rattlechains, Selfless Spirit, and Nebelgast Herald to disrupt opponents and protect your own creatures. With cards like Supreme Phantom and Empyrean Eagle boosting your spirits' power and toughness, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of flying, evasive attackers. Collected Company helps you dig for more creatures while maintaining pressure on your opponent, making this deck a fast-paced and aggressive option in the Pioneer format.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing aggressive creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Rotting Regisaur. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider. The deck utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Dread Wanderer to maintain a constant stream of threats. The deck's mana base focuses on supporting its aggressive strategy with efficient lands like Mutavault and Castle Locthwain.

The main concept of the deck is to establish a strong board presence early on with low-cost creatures and generate mana with Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to power out high-impact spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Heliod, Sun-Crowned. The deck focuses on aggression and speed, utilizing cards like Knight of the White Orchid and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit to apply pressure while controlling the board with removal spells like Stasis Snare and Baffling End. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of small creatures and powerful enchantments.
